Assessment.QuestionText: Which of these statements about customizing runtime reports are true and which statements are false?

Options.Option: Parameter fields help displaying the reports based on a criterion taken from the user.
Sorting fields help in sorting the data only in ascending and descending orders.
Selection formulas support passing formula to the <font face="courier new">SelectionFormulae</font> property of the <font face="courier new">CrystalReportViewer</font> class.
Selection formulas help to filter or group the data displayed in the report.
The <font face="courier new">RefreshReport()</font> method of the <font face="courier new">CrystalReportViewer</font> class refreshes the report after it has been changed.

Assessment.CorrectFeedback: Yes, that's correct! You get one point for your response.
Assessment.incorrectFeedback: No, that’s incorrect. The correct selections are: (A)–(True), (B)–(False), (C)–(False), (D)–(True), and (E)-(True).
